from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message
code.name: code

data_template.info: Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, StrInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message

class JSONExtractorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "JSON Extractor"
    description = "Extract specific fields from a JSON object."
    icon = "json"
    name = "JSONExtractor"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="json_data", display_name="JSON Data", info="The JSON object to extract data from."),
        StrInput(
            name="fields",
            display_name="Fields to Extract",
            info="Comma-separated list of fields to extract from the JSON object.",
            value="",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Extracted Data", name="extracted_data", method="extract_data"),
    ]

    def extract_data(self) -> Message:
        # Get the input data and fields
        json_data = self.json_data
        fields = [field.strip() for field in self.fields.split(",")]

        # Extract the requested fields from the JSON
        extracted = {}
        for field in fields:
            if field in json_data:
                extracted[field] = json_data[field]
            else:
                extracted[field] = None

        # Format the extracted data as text (or return the dict as needed)
        extracted_text = "\n".join([f"{key}: {value}" for key, value in extracted.items()])
        self.status = extracted_text
        return Message(text=extracted_text)
code.name: code

fields.name: fields
fields.info: Comma-separated list of fields to extract from the JSON object.

node.description: Extract specific fields from a JSON object.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)
code.name: code

template.name: template
template.info: The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.

node.description: Convert Data into plain text following a specified template.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class CustomComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Custom Component"
    description = "Use as a template to create your own component."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.axiestudio.org/components/custom"
    icon = "custom_components"
    name = "CustomComponent"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(name="input_value", display_name="Input Value", value="Hello, World!"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Output", name="output", method="build_output"),
    ]

    def build_output(self) -> Data:
        data = Data(value=self.input_value)
        self.status = data
        return data

import requests
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class EvolutionApiComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Evolution API Integration"
    description = "Envia mensagens via Evolution API."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.evolutionapi.com/"
    icon = "api"
    name = "EvolutionApiComponent"

    # Inputs do componente
    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="server_url",
            display_name="Server URL",
            info="Digite a URL do servidor Evolution API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="server_apikey",
            display_name="API Key",
            info="Cole a API key do servidor Evolution API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="instance_name",
            display_name="Nome da Instância",
            info="Digite o nome da instância que você está utilizando.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="recipient_number",
            display_name="Número do Destinatário",
            info="Digite o número do destinatário.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="message_content",
            display_name="Mensagem",
            info="Digite o conteúdo da mensagem.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="operation",
            display_name="Operador",
            options=["Enviar Texto", "Enviar Imagem", "Enviar Vídeo", "Enviar Áudio"],
            value="Enviar Texto",
            info="Escolha o tipo de mensagem a ser enviada.",
        ),
    ]

    # Outputs do componente
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Resposta da API", name="api_response", method="send_message"),
    ]

    def send_message(self) -> Data:
        """
        Constrói e envia uma mensagem via Evolution API usando POST com JSON.
        """
        if self.operation != "Enviar Texto":
            return Data(value="Operação não suportada. Apenas 'Enviar Texto' está implementado.")

        # Construção da URL da API
        url = f"{self.server_url}/message/sendText/{self.instance_name}"

        # Cabeçalhos da requisição
        headers = {
            "apikey": self.server_apikey,
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
        }

        # Payload da requisição (JSON)
        payload = {
            "number": self.recipient_number,
            "text": self.message_content,
        }

        try:
            # Envia a requisição POST com o payload JSON
            response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=payload)
            response.raise_for_status()  # Garante que a requisição foi bem-sucedida
            response_data = response.json()

            # Atualiza o status com a resposta da API
            self.status = f"Mensagem enviada com sucesso: {response_data}"
            return Data(value=response_data)
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
            # Captura e retorna o erro
            self.status = f"Erro ao enviar a mensagem: {str(e)}"
            return Data(value=str(e))
code.name: code

instance_name.info: Digite o nome da instância que você está utilizando.

operation.name: operation
operation.info: Escolha o tipo de mensagem a ser enviada.

server_apikey.info: Cole a API key do servidor Evolution API.

server_url.name: server_url

node.description: Envia mensagens via Evolution API.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)

from typing import List

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FilterDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Filter Data"
    description = "Filters a Data object based on a list of keys."
    icon = "filter"
    beta = True
    name = "FilterData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="data",
            display_name="Data",
            info="Data object to filter.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="filter_criteria",
            display_name="Filter Criteria",
            info="List of keys to filter by.",
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Filtered Data", name="filtered_data", method="filter_data"),
    ]

    def filter_data(self) -> Data:
        filter_criteria: List[str] = self.filter_criteria
        data = self.data.data if isinstance(self.data, Data) else {}

        # Filter the data
        filtered = {key: value for key, value in data.items() if key in filter_criteria}

        # Create a new Data object with the filtered data
        filtered_data = Data(data=filtered)
        self.status = filtered_data
        return filtered_data
code.name: code

filter_criteria.name: filter_criteria
filter_criteria.info: List of keys to filter by.

node.description: Filters a Data object based on a list of keys.

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.inputs import BoolInput
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.memory import store_message
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.utils.constants import MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER, MESSAGE_SENDER_AI


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"
    name = "ChatOutput"

    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Message to be passed as output.",
        ),
        BoolInput(
            name="should_store_message",
            display_name="Store Messages",
            info="Store the message in the history.",
            value=True,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="sender",
            display_name="Sender Type",
            options=[MESSAGE_SENDER_AI, MESSAGE_SENDER_USER],
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_AI,
            advanced=True,
            info="Type of sender.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="sender_name",
            display_name="Sender Name",
            info="Name of the sender.",
            value=MESSAGE_SENDER_NAME_AI,
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="session_id",
            display_name="Session ID",
            info="The session ID of the chat. If empty, the current session ID parameter will be used.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="data_template",
            display_name="Data Template",
            value="{text}",
            advanced=True,
            info="Template to convert Data to Text. If left empty, it will be dynamically set to the Data's text key.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Message", name="message", method="message_response"),
    ]

    def message_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
            sender=self.sender,
            sender_name=self.sender_name,
            session_id=self.session_id,
        )
        if (
            self.session_id
            and isinstance(message, Message)
            and isinstance(message.text, str)
            and self.should_store_message
        ):
            store_message(
                message,
                flow_id=self.graph.flow_id,
            )
            self.message.value = message

        self.status = message
        return message

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, StrInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message

class JSONExtractorComponent(Component):
    display_name = "JSON Extractor"
    description = "Extract specific fields from a JSON object."
    icon = "json"
    name = "JSONExtractor"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="json_data", display_name="JSON Data", info="The JSON object to extract data from."),
        StrInput(
            name="fields",
            display_name="Fields to Extract",
            info="Comma-separated list of fields to extract from the JSON object.",
            value="",
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Extracted Data", name="extracted_data", method="extract_data"),
    ]

    def extract_data(self) -> Message:
        # Get the input data and fields
        json_data = self.json_data
        fields = [field.strip() for field in self.fields.split(",")]

        # Extract the requested fields from the JSON
        extracted = {}
        for field in fields:
            if field in json_data:
                extracted[field] = json_data[field]
            else:
                extracted[field] = None

        # Format the extracted data as text (or return the dict as needed)
        extracted_text = "\n".join([f"{key}: {value}" for key, value in extracted.items()])
        self.status = extracted_text
        return Message(text=extracted_text)
code.name: code

fields.name: fields
fields.info: Comma-separated list of fields to extract from the JSON object.

node.description: Extract specific fields from a JSON object.

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.helpers.data import data_to_text
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MultilineInput, Output, StrInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class ParseDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Parse Data"
    description = "Convert Data into plain text following a specified template."
    icon = "braces"
    name = "ParseData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(name="data", display_name="Data", info="The data to convert to text."),
        MultilineInput(
            name="template",
            display_name="Template",
            info="The template to use for formatting the data. It can contain the keys {text}, {data} or any other key in the Data.",
            value="{text}",
        ),
        StrInput(name="sep", display_name="Separator", advanced=True, value="\n"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="parse_data"),
    ]

    def parse_data(self) -> Message:
        data = self.data if isinstance(self.data, list) else [self.data]
        template = self.template

        result_string = data_to_text(template, data, sep=self.sep)
        self.status = result_string
        return Message(text=result_string)

import requests
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import MessageTextInput, DropdownInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class EvolutionApiComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Evolution API Integration"
    description = "Envia mensagens via Evolution API."
    documentation: str = "http://docs.evolutionapi.com/"
    icon = "api"
    name = "EvolutionApiComponent"

    # Inputs do componente
    inputs = [
        MessageTextInput(
            name="server_url",
            display_name="Server URL",
            info="Digite a URL do servidor Evolution API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="server_apikey",
            display_name="API Key",
            info="Cole a API key do servidor Evolution API.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="instance_name",
            display_name="Nome da Instância",
            info="Digite o nome da instância que você está utilizando.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="recipient_number",
            display_name="Número do Destinatário",
            info="Digite o número do destinatário.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="message_content",
            display_name="Mensagem",
            info="Digite o conteúdo da mensagem.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="operation",
            display_name="Operador",
            options=["Enviar Texto", "Enviar Imagem", "Enviar Vídeo", "Enviar Áudio"],
            value="Enviar Texto",
            info="Escolha o tipo de mensagem a ser enviada.",
        ),
    ]

    # Outputs do componente
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Resposta da API", name="api_response", method="send_message"),
    ]

    def send_message(self) -> Data:
        """
        Constrói e envia uma mensagem via Evolution API usando POST com JSON.
        """
        if self.operation != "Enviar Texto":
            return Data(value="Operação não suportada. Apenas 'Enviar Texto' está implementado.")

        # Construção da URL da API
        url = f"{self.server_url}/message/sendText/{self.instance_name}"

        # Cabeçalhos da requisição
        headers = {
            "apikey": self.server_apikey,
            "Content-Type": "application/json",
        }

        # Payload da requisição (JSON)
        payload = {
            "number": self.recipient_number,
            "text": self.message_content,
        }

        try:
            # Envia a requisição POST com o payload JSON
            response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=payload)
            response.raise_for_status()  # Garante que a requisição foi bem-sucedida
            response_data = response.json()

            # Atualiza o status com a resposta da API
            self.status = f"Mensagem enviada com sucesso: {response_data}"
            return Data(value=response_data)
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
            # Captura e retorna o erro
            self.status = f"Erro ao enviar a mensagem: {str(e)}"
            return Data(value=str(e))

from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, MessageTextInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema import Data


class FilterDataComponent(Component):
    display_name = "Filter Data"
    description = "Filters a Data object based on a list of keys."
    icon = "filter"
    beta = True
    name = "FilterData"

    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="data",
            display_name="Data",
            info="Data object to filter.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="filter_criteria",
            display_name="Filter Criteria",
            info="List of keys to filter by.",
            is_list=True,
        ),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Filtered Data", name="filtered_data", method="filter_data"),
    ]

    def filter_data(self) -> Data:
        filter_criteria: List[str] = self.filter_criteria
        data = self.data.data if isinstance(self.data, Data) else {}

        # Filter the data
        filtered = {key: value for key, value in data.items() if key in filter_criteria}

        # Create a new Data object with the filtered data
        filtered_data = Data(data=filtered)
        self.status = filtered_data
        return filtered_data
code.name: code

filter_criteria.name: filter_criteria
filter_criteria.info: List of keys to filter by.

node.description: Filters a Data object based on a list of keys.
